Anita is a common given name for women. In Sanskrit, Anita means full of grace, mercy, favor, variety, a leader, without guile. The name is the Spanish version of Anne. In Hebrew, Anita derives from the name Hannah which means grace or graceful. Furthermore, Anita is the short form for Anahita, the Iranian Water Goddess in Avestan language (an East Iranian language), and also has the meanings of kindness and being personable. The name Anita is mostly used in Hungary and Spanish, Portuguese, Italian speaking countries as well as Indian languages with Sanskrit origins.

[ 3 syll. a-ni-la, an-ila ] The baby girl name Anila is pronounced as aa-N IY-Laa- †. Anila has its origins in the Sanskrit language and it is used largely in Indian. The name Anila means 'the wind god'. Anila is the feminine version of the Chinese and Vietnamese An and the English and Indian Anil. Forms of Anila include the names Anilah, Anilla, Anyla, Anylah, Anylla, and Anyllah. Anila is not often used as a baby girl name. It is not in the top 1000 names
